title: Old fashioned, decorative, script
content:
Hey everyone!

Looking for a font similar to the "Aventine" in the below pic- any ideas??

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [aventine-2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017001459/http:/typophile.com/files/aventine-2_0.jpg) | 118.92 KB |
author: caperobin

comments.content:
First, I would not call this a script, but a serif font.

I think this is custom. The style mixes some Latin (triangular) serifs with ruled or slab serifs. The most similar font I found was Castle Type's [Vincenzo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017001459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/vincenzo/). It has similar serifs, although the middle arm of the E is too long. The necessary changes could be made by flattening the letters and adjusting the center arm of the E.

Then the three dimensional effects would have to be done with layering.

- Mike Yanega
Oops yes meant to type serif, can you tell I'm stressed? ;D Many thanks for your suggestion!
